intro: Linociera ligustrina, commonly known as the Chinese evergreen or Chinese holly, is a species of flowering plant in the family Berberidaceae. It is native to eastern Asia, particularly China, where it grows in forested areas. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, clustered white flowers that appear in late spring. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a glossy, dark green appearance. Linociera ligustrina is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its aesthetic appeal and ability to thrive in shaded environments.
